issue.title: arrow_available() is not TRUE on CentOS 7
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12544](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12544). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
libarrow is not being properly installed, see https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=4264&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=d9b15392-e4ce-5e4c-0c8c-b69645229181&l=3877

this is related to https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4471, in the CI we can see the error "Cannot call Int32__initialize()" (https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=4264&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=d9b15392-e4ce-5e4c-0c8c-b69645229181&l=284)

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12544?focusedCommentId=17332714) by Mauricio 'Pachá' Vargas Sepúlveda (pachamaltese):*
as discussed with Jonathan Keane, this is a transient error (502 HTTP error), so I'm closing this
ref: https://dev.azure.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/_build/results?buildId=4264&view=logs&j=0da5d1d9-276d-5173-c4c4-9d4d4ed14fdb&t=6c939d89-0d1a-51f2-8b30-091a7a82e98c&l=875
